image.altText: A man and woman hold a framed photo of their daughter

props.synopsis: Australia records its highest number of asthma deaths in a decade but a peak body says there is no straight answers as to why there has been an increase or why women like Ashleigh Young are more vulnerable.

title.children: Australia has recorded the highest number of asthma deaths in a decade. And it's killing more women than men

image.altText: A still from a video showing a confrontation between two men standing up as others watch on.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation has uncovered a series of allegations by former workers blowing the whistle on mistreatment, neglect and excessive use of force against people with disabilities being cared for by NDIS provider Evolution Support Services.

title.children: Jake's support worker tells him to settle down. Seconds later, there's a sickening crack and a cry of pain

image.altText: A group of people hold up university certificates. All faces are blurred except the man in the middle.

props.synopsis: Artem Vasilyev was working as an electrical engineer for the Department of Defence when raids on his Findon home uncovered firearms and substances used to make explosives, a jury has been told.

title.children: Terror plot accused had guns, chemicals and extremist material, court hears

image.altText: Two men stand together with their arms around each other

props.synopsis: Disappearances are not uncommon in Mexico. But in their haste to close the case of murdered surfers Jake and Callum Robinson and Carter Rhoad, local authorities have left a lot of questions unanswered.

title.children: Jake and Callum Robinson's deaths have raised questions over cartel involvement. A former detective explains why

image.altText: Adam Bandt

props.synopsis: The federal Greens are calling for Israel's ambassador to Australia to be expelled, as Israel prepares an invasion of the southern Gaza city of Rafah.

title.children: Greens call for Israeli ambassador's expulsion over looming Rafah invasion

image.altText: A man in a white t-shirt stands in front of a group of tents.

props.synopsis: Pro-Palestinian activists camping at the University of Adelaide say fireworks scorched tents when they were let off around their campsite.

title.children: 'Cowardly tactic': Fireworks thrown at university protest camp

image.altText: a blonde lady standing looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Flinders Medical Centre treated patients in corridors during a recent period of high demand, prompting South Australia's doctor's union to report their concerns to the state's safety watchdog.

title.children: Hospital's corridor care while overcrowded a 'health and safety risk', union says

image.altText: A composite image showing a variety of book covers set on an angle against a bright yellow background

props.synopsis: The Australian Book Industry Awards recognise the talented authors and publishers behind the books that generated the most buzz in the last 12 months.

title.children: Aussie retailers tried to ban this kids book. Now it's a winner at the 2024 book industry awards

image.altText: Whyalla steelworks

props.synopsis: GFG Alliance admits the Whyalla steelworks blast furnace has been damaged during efforts to repair it and the company has pushed back its estimate of when it hopes to restart production.

title.children: 'Grave concerns': Whyalla steelworks shutdown may take longer than anticipated

image.altText: A young girl is silhouetted against fading evening sun holding a football in one hand while walking across sand dune ridge

props.synopsis: In the shadow of Uluru, an unprecedented football carnival was quietly held for young First Nations women from remote communities. More than sport was at play.

title.children: In the shadow of Uluru, the most remarkable football carnival you've never heard of tried to change history

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair and red glasses looks slightly off camera with a serious expression

props.synopsis: The former South Australian Human Services minister has revealed the diagnosis came as a shock but she has no plans to stop serving as a shadow minister.

title.children: South Australian MLC Michelle Lensink shares breast cancer news

image.altText: Nikel metal

props.synopsis: As the world decarbonises, Australia's resources sector is hoping for more government support in Tuesday's federal budget to extract and process critical minerals.

title.children: 'There is no net zero without Australia': Why industry wants more budget money for critical minerals

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide business owner accused of indecently assaulting women during job interviews across a period of 13 months has been released on electronically monitored home detention bail.

title.children: Businessman accused of indecent assaults in job interviews granted bail

image.altText: A Palestinian man stands looking through a opening in a building, watching as smoke rises after Israeli strikes.

props.synopsis: The US acknowledges its 2,000-pound bombs cause civilian deaths in Gaza and will pause supply on a shipment of the heavy weapons to Israel over concerns about their use in Rafah.

title.children: 'Powerful symbolic move': What we know about the US halt on heavy bomb supplies to Israel

image.altText: A man leans on a glass window.

props.synopsis: Former Victorian racing integrity commissioner Sal Perna is appointed to oversee reforms within South Australia's greyhound industry, after revelations of animal abuse triggered an independent inquiry.

title.children: Greyhound integrity chief appointed after animal abuse revealed by ABC

image.altText: Matildas goalie Lydia Williams poses for a portrait in a black jersey. She is looking into the distance with her arms crossed.

props.synopsis: Matildas goalkeeper Lydia Williams has announced she will retire from international football after the 2024 Paris Olympics.

title.children: 'It's been a wonderful ride': Matildas longest-serving player Lydia Williams announces retirement

image.altText: Anthony Albanese at a press conference at Parliament House

props.synopsis: Another high-profile immigration decision and a rocky relationship with China are likely the last things the prime minister wants to be talking about ahead of the Federal Budget release next week.

title.children: With China tensions boiling again and a high court decision looming, the PM's pre-budget week is anything but

image.altText: Troy SMith

props.synopsis: An Australian man has been arrested and charged with alleged drug offences in Bali, local authorities have confirmed.

title.children: Australian man arrested and charged for alleged drug offences in Bali

image.altText: Side-profile mid-close-up of a white man in a light blue collared shirt, walking past a big news camera.

props.synopsis: Mr Wright is facing a criminal charge relating to the aftermath of a helicopter crash which killed his Netflix co-star in 2022. Whether that will go to a trial is now unknown.

title.children: Netflix star Matt Wright's lawyers in bid to avoid 'full-blown jury trial' over charge

image.altText: Split screen of Kate Thwaites, Michele Ananda-Rajah, Sally Sitou and Jerome Laxale side by side

props.synopsis: Labor backbenchers say they were caught off guard by the government's new gas policy, which the Resources minister says will keep the fossil fuel in Australia's energy mix until 2050 "and beyond".

title.children: Labor backbench 'blindsided' by Albanese's gas strategy that keeps fuel 'to 2050 and beyond'

image.altText: Two men wearing orange vests and blue helments stand in front of a power station

props.synopsis: Accused by the Nationals of making a wrong call over a controversial carbon capture project, Liberal deputy leader Sussan Ley hits back, exposing a split at the highest levels of the Coalition.

title.children: This carbon project has united greenies, farmers and Australia's richest woman. But it's divided the Coalition

image.altText: A photograph of a strap protruding through the wall into the cabin of a plane, next to a seat.

props.synopsis: The Australian Transport Safety Bureau calls for vigilance, publishing a report into an incident in which a strap was left on the propeller of a plane that took off from Canberra Airport, damaging the aircraft and injuring a passenger, in 2022.

title.children: Report recommends stricter safety measures after propeller strap punctured aircraft taking off from Canberra Airport

image.altText: A composite image of photos from the 2023-24 A-League Women season

props.synopsis: From a new club to record crowds, the A-League Women tallied several big wins this season. But could the competition have done more to capitalise on the World Cup?

title.children: Did the A-League Women make the most of the Matildas' World Cup legacy?

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair standing in a green paddock, holding a framed photo of a man.

props.synopsis: Patrick Liedke, 39, was last seen west of Tweed Heads on April 22. His car was found on April 26 on a property nearby. His sister has strong hopes he is still out there.

title.children: Family of missing man rallies team of volunteers to help find him after police call off search

image.altText: A boy sitting near a garden

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has confirmed it's pulling funding from three youth hubs in Alice Springs town camps.

title.children: Youth hubs scrapped in Alice Springs, amid claims they 'aren't hitting the mark'

image.altText: A close up of Greg Lynn standing in front of a body of water near some rocks.

props.synopsis: A Supreme Court judge has told a panel of potential jurors that it will be alleged Greg Lynn shot Carol Clay and killed Russell Hill, who both went missing while camping in Victoria's High Country in 2020.

title.children: Greg Lynn allegedly shot Victorian camper, potential jurors told as murder trial begins

image.altText: Troy Mercanti

props.synopsis: Notorious bikie Troy Mercanti is awarded costs after rape charges against him relating to an alleged incident in Karrinyup are dropped in a Perth court today.

title.children: Rape charges against Perth bikie Troy Mercanti dropped amid coercion fears for alleged victim

image.altText: A young woman performs a kick in a black outfit.

props.synopsis: Large sections of the community support a ban, hoping it will help put a stop to violence, but martial arts leaders and advocates are outraged.

title.children: Geovania learnt kung-fu to 'defend herself'. These days she can't — her government has banned it

image.altText: A white, green and blue Air Vanuatu plane in the sky above the blue Pacific ocean

props.synopsis: Australian tourists are stranded in Vanuatu after the country's national airline cancelled international flights for four days, while the Vanuatu government considers putting it into voluntary administration.

title.children: Australians stranded in Vanuatu as national airline teeters on the brink of voluntary administration

image.altText: Patrick Cripps celebrates a goal

props.synopsis: Carlton has snapped a two-game losing streak, but not before a thrilling late Melbourne comeback attempt in the final quarter. Follow live.

title.children: Carlton survives incredible Melbourne heist attempt in heart-stopping final quarter

image.altText: Tom Trbojevic limps off the field and holds his head

props.synopsis: The Dolphins edge past Manly, who surrender another first-half lead and see fullback Tom Trbojevic and winger Jason Saab suffer injuries.

title.children: Injured Tom Trbojevic facing another stint on sidelines as Dolphins beat Manly

image.altText: A large aircraft takes off from an airport.

props.synopsis: "Bruce", the first of Bonza's repossessed 737-Max 8 aircraft, takes off from the Sunshine Coast to an unknown overseas destination after negotiations to keep the budget airline in the air failed.

title.children: Bonza's aircraft leave the country after fleet repossessed
